lead_paragraph: Jörg Jaksche of Germany, the first rider to admit using blood doping prepared by a Spanish doctor in the Operation Puerto scandal, was barred for a year by the Austrian cycling federation. Just before the start of this year’s Tour de France, Jaksche, 30, who lives in Austria, admitted he had used performance enhancers since 1997, and blood doping prepared by the Spanish doctor Eufemiano Fuentes since 2005.
